parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofpr </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.75</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Unit Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Vehicle Inventory </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Returns array of names of all unit's weapons. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''weapons''' vehicleName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> vehicleName: [[Object]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value>  [[Array]] of weapon names. </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_wArray <ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/><inner>=</inner><close></nowiki></close></ext> [[weapons]] [[player]];</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[magazines]], [[weaponsTurret]], [[assignedVehicleRole]] [[weaponState]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

</value></part></template>

<h3 style="display:none">Notes</h3>
<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on 12:07, 20 January 2007
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Bdfy|Bdfy]]'''<dd class="note">
(A1 1.02) this command returns only weapons defined for the primary turret of the vehicle. 
for ex. only ["D81", "PKT"] for t72, not ["D81", "PKT","DSHKM"]

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 06:01, 3 March 2007 (CET)
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Donnervogel|Donnervogel]]'''<dd class="note">''weapons'' never returns the weapon "Throw" which all soldier units have have to throw handgrenades. You'd have to use [[hasWeapon]] to verfy it. Also handgrenades are not listed since they are magazines. Use [[magazines]] for that.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 11 March 2011
<dt class="note>'''[[User:kju|kju]]'''
<dd class="note">
Use [[weaponsTurret]] to determine the weapons of a non gunner/turret position.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 25 November 2011
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Dr_Eyeball|Dr_Eyeball]]'''
<dd class="note">
This command does not include non-turret weapons, such as smoke, flare or chaff launchers which are usually declared in the root of the vehicle's class, rather than in the Turrets hierarchy. (Unsure whether it excludes it because it is not in the turret or because these are not considered true weapons via some property.)

<dd class="notedate">Posted on 18 June 2013
<dt class="note>'''[[User:Druid|Druid]]'''
<dd class="note">
Lists also weapons in inventory from Arma 3 ver. 0.70.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
